summary: The Extending Expired Cybersecurity Authorities Act, introduced in the Senate, aims to reauthorize the Cybersecurity Information Sharing Act of 2015. It extends specific provisions of the original act, primarily section 111(a), to September 30, 2035, with a retroactive effective date of October 1, 2025. It also renames the original act and makes conforming amendments throughout the Homeland Security Act of 2002, changing the name to the Protecting America from Cyber Threats Act.
